Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: Michele3825
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some very nice hotels; however this is by far THE BEST. From the moment I arrived at the hotel, I was treated like royalty. The room was incredible! Wood floors, floor to ceiling windows with electric drapes, top of the line electronics, iPad (used to communicate with the hotel for room service, valet, housekeeping and internet, etc) and iPod docking station, surround sound, extremely spacious, and beautiful decor. It seemed as though I was at a luxury high rise condo instead of a hotel. The staff was impeccable! They were friendly and went above and beyond to ensure I had everything I needed during my stay. Breakfast and a welcoming cocktail is included and they both were a nice benefit. There were so many things (pool, basketball, virtual bowling & skee ball, and spa) to do that I didn't want to leave the hotel. My expectations were far exceeded. The price is well worth it for this quality of hotel and Level service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views, good service, valet needs work”
Reviews.Author: HVB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Marriott points and were pleasantly upgraded at check in to a wonderful Junior Suite with amazing views (room 3826). Perhaps because my husband is elite with Marriott or that I mentioned it was his birthday in the email we received from the hotel a week prior to our arrival. The room was enormous and yes the water in the bathroom was pretty cool. The porter who brought our luggage showed me how to use the coffee machine, which made lovely coffee and the hotel was generous with giving at least 6 if not 8 coffee pods. I enjoyed several cups of coffee! The bathroom was large with a gorgeous light fixture and I enjoyed a bath in the immense tub after a long day of walking. We did not use the pool area although it was not very busy when we checked. The beds are comfortable of course. The ceilings reflect which was a little strange but not too detracting. The rooms are very clean and I loved the floor, it was wood! I hate hotel carpeting! The furniture was very comfortable and trendy looking at the same time. The little touches like Art books on display made this large room seem very friendly and homey. The ipad interface was interesting but I'd rather have a recommendation from a human as to things to do/ places to go, etc. We used it once to retrieve our car from the valet and it took 45 minutes to get our car. I was not happy at all. Valet is the only option. We did not make too much of a fuss about it though. When we got back to our room there was a small bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries with a Happy Birthday note for my husband which was a very nice touch, and also delicious. We highly enjoyed cocktails and dinner at db bistro moderne. I will review it separately but if you like good food it's worth it to go there. The noise in the room was negligible. I was concerned because the doors seem heavy and I thought they would slam but not once did I hear another guest. The welcome cocktail also came with some snacks in a nice lounge and the lady working there (I already forgot her name) was so delightful. When we mentioned we were heading out on a cruise the next day she offered to print us the weather forecasts for where we were going. The service level is outstanding. Everyone you encounter asks how your stay is and offers to help. The only weak link was the valet and expensive too at $35 per day! It's a great deal on points but we'd pay for a room on a return visit. It was an exceptional and unique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views with top notch room”
Reviews.Author: Joef22
Reviews.Content: For starters if you have Marriott Rewards points this hotel is a must stay. A bit pricey if you had to pay but they include breakfast and the staff was very helpful and nice. All the rooms come with Ipad's to help assit you if you need anything. Great location. Perfect for a romantic evening to spend and plenty of Restaurants near by. Bed was just amazing. Private Reception for you to check in and out. The room that i stayed in was over 1300 sqaure feet with a whirl pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic views although pricey”
Reviews.Author: explorrer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just for 1 night just before we started our cruise from the overlooking port and it was a superb experience. I got an upgrade to a bay view from a city view room and it was totally worth it. Rooms were very luxurious and filled with technology! all entertainment equipment was from bang and olfusen was cool. And we could use all the facilities from marriott which was very good...including using the points from marriottrewards.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Felix1209
Reviews.Content: I loved it - if to be short:) They try to meet and exceed guests expectations. Starting from their e-mail prior you visit - they check your arrival time and ask for any special requirements..it's a nice touch! Breakfast is included, upon arrival you get complimentary drink and have a smooth check-in at 39 floor if I'm not mistaking. The room is wonderful and full of gadgets which I really love. The view is outstanding and no questions or concerns at all! If you are not looking for a beach hotel this one would be a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “All About The "Cool" Factor”
Reviews.Author: dwertin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about its "cool" factor, from the decor to the electronics. So smart of Marriott to pursue this niche boutique market, and launching a hotel in Miami was brilliant. You definitely do NOT feel like you are in a Marriott once you leave the lobby (the hotel is the top several floors of the JW Marriott on Biscayne Boulevard). It was exceptionally clean, which is no small feat with all the glass and stainless steel in the bathroom, and the basics as well as the other amenities were top notch. It can be a bit complicated to operate all of the technology - the alarm clock also turns off the t.v., which lives embedded into a wall until you invite it out with the touch of a button. The gym and other recreational options are also high end. We ordered room service on the hotel-provided iPad and were also able to use the iPad - which had a nice application installed that allowed us to easily request a taxi, call for our car, check in for flights, learn about local attractions, shopping, nightlife, restaurants, etc. The food was not exceptional as it almost seemed like the menu tries too hard to be avant garde, but it was fine and the welcome glass of champagne (one of many choices of welcome "snacks") was very nice. It is pricey but we used Marriott points to stay there - now that we know what we will "get", we are very likely to return. It is not near South Beach and is not a "beach" experience. It is a destination in itself and a perfect place to stay if you are just looking to take in Miami for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “I challenge you to set the alarm clock...”
Reviews.Author: gottdownunder
Reviews.Content: You won't know how, but that's ok, you won't care. What a great splurge...they upgraded me to a suite and it was just amazing. Nice brunch in the morning...turn down service where they turn on the radio and lights for your return, and they even re-cleaned the room from my shower. Two huge TVs that automatically swivel on their stand, use of an Ipad, nice pool on 19th floor with great view...what a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: senhorcook
Reviews.Content: This was a first class hotel with fantastic Miami views. Hotel staff was very polite but a little slow to respond to room service. Not cheap, but a great experience. The electronics are fabulous! And check out the bathroom sink.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: Before you go to the hotel, they will email you to ask for opinions and requirements. When you are in hotel, they treat you with a free welcome drink. As for the room, I am in a junior king suite. The living room is with bay and city views. That must be one of the most amazing view of Miami from 38 floor! The king size bed was really nice and comfortable. With free breakfast and nice ipad provided, this hotel complete and enhance the whole value of the trip. I like this hotel so much. If I would ever visit Miami area again, I would definitely stay in here. For all the good services, good room, new facility, and nice things here, I love this hotel so so so so much....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Beaux Arts for 6 days, starting Oct 27th. It was simply perfect. Generally, when visiting Miami, we have stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Miami Beach. At first, we thought we would miss not being right on the beach, but, it turned out to be not that big of a deal. And frankly, we were so dazzled by all the technology and highly buffed wood in this suite, that we hardly noticed we weren't on the beach. If you were listening to me, you may have heard may say: "I think this is the nicest hotel I have ever visited." Of course, we had the suite located on the 40th floor which over-looked Biscayne Bay on one side and magnificent city scapes on the other side--that made it very easy to forget what we didn't have. A bell hop led us up to the 39th floor reception area. Before not too long, we had complementary cocktails in our hands, and we were officially greeted by the hotel staff. Shortly afterwards, the conceirge led us to our suite, opened the door, and escorted us down a long entry corridor that also housed the half bath, and led to the living room. He immediately began a rehearsed script where he explained all the technology in the suite. He explained the B.O. televisions (there were 3 in the suite), the phone system, the stereo system, the electronic drapes, the electronically rotating tv stand, one of the 3 tvs hidden behind the bathroom mirror, the alarm clock that also doubled as a remote control for the bedroom television, the electronically colored and controlled bathroom faucets, and on and on! he also pointed out the jacuzzi tub and separate waterfall shower stall--everything done up in the richest brown marble (or granite, or whatever it was). There was also a security video screen on the door, and an electronic system integrated with the card key that turned on lights and signaled staff to enter the suite for servicing, or to stay away. There were also upgraded toilets (I believe Toto). There was so much going on that, at first it was a little intimadating and overwhelming--and fun!!! The suite was immaculately appointed and well thought out, from head to toe...just take my word for it. They did not miss a trick! Ultra modern, sleek and minimal, but, supple and rich, with buffed wood paneling everywhere, including the ceilings. So buffed that you could see yourself in it. We ate complementary breakfast in the 39th floor breakfast room, also beautifully decorated, every morning, surrounded by panoramic views of the city skyline and the waterways. the staff was delightful and well trained to accomodate guests' wishes and requests. They took really good care of us. I simply can't say enough about this experience. We truly enjoyed this experience from begining to end. We had dinner in the restaurant on the first floor--excellent. Sergio, the MBistro manager, noticed that we were not altogether pleased with all the selections on the menu, came over to find out what was going on. We explained that the menu in our suite was different than what was in the restaruant, and we had already decided what we wanted. He explained that they had just changed the menu, told us not to worry, and that he would take care of it---and he did. We bowled and played pool, and stuck our toes in the pool! We had messages at the spa. It was just great. We ended up spending a lot of time in the hotel because we were enjoying it so much. The only negative thing was staff was very slow at bringing ice. Then they would bring 4 or 5 buckets when they finally showed up, and they would also enter the suite before getting permission to do so. But, at the end of the day, these were both very small issues. This hotel is at the top of the list for us, and we will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: steven b
Reviews.Content: What a find! We stayed for 3 days as a retirement treat and were upgraded to a marvellous suite with both city and bay views - stunning from the 39th floor. The b&o equipment within the room was amazing, the lounge even had its own separate toilet and sink, a great illy espresso machine, electric operated curtains, really comfy couch with chaise lounge. The bed was really comfortable with italian cotton sheeting. The bathroom had a large whirlpool bath, a separate large shower with overhead and wall shower heads. Really cool double sinks that lit the water coming out of the faucet either red or blue depending on the temperature plus a television behind the glass mirror. Ethan and Ryan at the concierge desk couldn't be more welcoming and helpful. The european breakfast was great, made even more enjoyable by the pleasant server Stephanie. These rooms on just 4 floors have their own bar, lounge and TV room areas should you not want to remain in your room. Also worth a mention is the exceptional cooking at the daniel butler restaurant. The $38 fixed price 3 course dinner is great value, again the waiters were first rate. The gym is very well equipped and it was great to watch the boats on the bay whilst on the running machines. The spa is also luxurious, Courtney a brilliant masseuse. I wish we could have stayed there longer. This is a hotel where paying that bit extra really is worth it. I have stayed in some of the leading hotels of the world and can honestly say this hotel should be considered as the creme de la creme.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Luxury Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_Aguilar
Reviews.Content: This property is actually the top 4 floors of the JW Marriott Marquis on Biscayne Boulevard, downtown Miami. Steps off of the financial district, Mary Brickell Village and great dining and nightlife. My wife and I had a great stay - beautiful views of Briscayne Bay and the islands and keys off of downtown. High tech to the max and chic decor. Everything was connected by remote control or hotel provided iPad. Totally unreal - was blown away at the luxury, technology views and sexiness of this hotel. Not Cheap - our room, a 1BR luxury suite was going for ~$900/night.

Reviews.Title: “Bipolar”
Reviews.Author: Delta77L
Reviews.Content: There is just one word that comes to my mind after staying at this hotel. Bipolar. The Good: It started out great with the pre-arrival concierge which made some restaurant reservations for us. And once we got to the hotel, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The room was just awesome with bang and olufson electronics everywhere and great views of the bay. The pool was also very good, as was DB Bistro. The Bad: first off, we went to the concierge lounge one afternoon and asked for some soda and we were served very promptly, but then were were given the check for $10! For two 10oz sodas. That is just outrageous, after paying a premium just to stay at this hotel over the JW, they charge $5 for a single soda. Also, the JW tried to charge us for playing pool in the billiards room after we were told it was free of charge. Next time I am in Miami I will not be staying at this property again. I would vote for the Mandarin Oriental or the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: amlash
Reviews.Content: This is a brand-new boutique hotel within the JW Marriott on Biscayne Blvd. The rooms are well-planned, beautiful, and comfortable. The lounge area is excellent with wonderful breakfast and cocktail options. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Eliza W
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, I love this hotel. So many gadgets, upscale, beautiful and trendy. Love the lounge, love the breakfast, love the personal service, love the food. Bathroom is amazing, view is the best in Miami. TV comes out from the wall for closer view, great stereo system. Love the white furniture, it fits the hotel and Miami. Great customer service with you own staff and Ipad. I worte the names of all the staff for my stay but lost the paper, so I want to say to the staff; thanks for a great stay. Cannot wait to return to this joy. Valet parking fee is high but this hotel makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “The MOST beautiful EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ispeaktheblondetruth
Reviews.Content: I absolutey loved this hotel, everything about it says style and class. We were lucky enough to use Marriott points to stay for 5 nights, when I walked into our suite I was just stunned, I announced to the porter that I wanted to live here it was just so beautiful. the lounge had a White leather corner unit and what must have been a 50" inch tv. There was a bang and olufson (?) stereo and each room had an iPad to use, I have my own but it's a brilliant touch. The bathroom is stunning with a stainless steel sink with colour changing taps. The whirlpool bath had a waterfall feature, sadly I never got around to using it, the shower was too good. This hotel is situated within the JW Mariott Marquis, occupying the top three floors, it shares many of the facilities (which I've already reviewed) but it does have it's own check in desk (with a very personalised service) and it's own concierge lounge which again is sooooo special, it has several separate areas and is really contemporary and at night almost becomes a little private members nightclub. I was tempted not to leave a review for this hotel as it is so special I'd like to keep it all for myself. Forgot to mention after check in, got to the suite and their was complentary glass of champagne and nibbles - just one one the little touches which make this hotel a touch of class.
